results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Earth revealed”.
This episode introduces the vast field of geology and the work undertaken by scientists in that and other related fields. Excellent visuals stimulate the viewer’s appreciation of the Earth and a broad overview is provided on Plate Tectonics, earthquakes, seismology and the origins of our planet.

results.title: The Blizzard of Aahhh's
results.brief_description: Take three of the world’s best stunt skiers - cliff-jumper Scot Schmidt, extreme skier - Bad boy Glen Plake, and precision skier Mike Hattrup … transport them to the finest steep terrain in the world - from Switzerland to France’s Chamonix Valley to California’s awe inspiring Squaw Valley … engage some slick cameramen … set the results to an original soundtrack ranging from hot rap to Euro-funk, including Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Propaganda and ACT … and what do you have? “The Blizzard of AAHHH’s” - a vividly photographed, tightly edited rock video movie. Ever bolder jumps, twists, straight shots through chutes, games of chicken with crevasses and other activities designed to make insurance company rate-setters squeal with delight! Rated: G

results.title: The Blue Planet (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, Dept of Marine Services and University of Sydney Television Service
results.brief_description: Looks at the oceans of the World and the development of, and basics of oceanography. Considers the effect and benefit of scientific study of the oceans for sailors, yachtsmen, surfers, environmentalists, scientists, engineers and architects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, Dept of Marine Services and University of Sydney Television Service

results.title: The Black pages
results.brief_description: Stunning yet restrained cinematography is a feature of this beautifully lit work which demonstrates controlled use of colour in a piece employing controlled kinetic movement within the frame. Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.

results.title: Stories from Birchip
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Jason White, David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Ten stories recorded by ACMI in the Mallee town of Birchip (and one about an Art Deco cinema in nearby Charlton) to celebrate the annual Small Towns summit hosted by Birchip in August 2007. Each film created to be a part of the ACMI MAP (Memory and Place) project is under 7 minutes long and is specifically about relationship to place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dean Lawry, Jason White, David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.description: Ten stories recorded by ACMI in the Mallee town of Birchip (and one about an Art Deco cinema in nearby Charlton) to celebrate the annual Small Towns summit hosted by Birchip in August 2007. results.title: Amour de la toilette
results.brief_description:
Subtlety is the key to this brilliantly conceived hand drawn animation that employs the simple technology of a whiteboard and markers to create an engaging evocation of Paris. The use of minimalist materials is supported by thorough planning skills, the controlled use of camera and a storyline that is achievable within the limitations of the medium.
Music by The Cafe Accordian Orchestra.

results.title: Deception
results.brief_description: This evocative subtitled work is beautifully framed enhancing the depiction of its black yet familiar themes which are further supported through considered use of narrative pace, attention to lighting and effective use of special effects.

results.title: Bus stop
results.brief_description:
This animation employs a fearless use of monochrome to enhance its sophisticated intertextual referencing of classic cartoons. The original music both supports and acts as a counterpoint to the storyline.
‘Fast lane’ performed by Lucid.

results.title: Push
results.brief_description: This engaging work explores the narrative device of ‘what if?’ to create a quirky and fun filled piece demonstrating sophisticated control of compositing in a playful exploration of the possibilities of technology.
